name: Kyverno High Admission Webhook Failures.txt - Issue:
description: This section highlights an issue where the admission failures in a Kubernetes cluster are high, indicating a potential problem with the Kyverno admission webhook. The alert should mention the specific cluster and namespace where the high failure rate is occurring, allowing administrators to investigate and resolve the issue.
use_cases: Identifying clusters and namespaces with high admission failure rates
Alerting on critical admission webhook issues
Troubleshooting and resolving admission webhook failures

name: Kyverno High Admission Webhook Failures.txt - Debugging:
description: This section suggests that the high admission webhook failures could potentially lead to Pods entering an unavailable state or experiencing a crash loop backoff. It provides guidance for debugging such issues, which may be helpful for troubleshooting and resolving problems related to Kyverno's admission webhook.
use_cases: Resolving issues with Pods going into an unavailable state
Addressing crash loop backoff scenarios related to Kyverno's admission webhook

name: Kyverno High Admission Webhook Failures.txt - Resolution:
description: This section suggests that when encountering high admission webhook failures related to Kyverno, the user should examine the pod logs to identify the specific policy that is causing the failure. It recommends investigating the logs to pinpoint the root cause of the issue.
use_cases: Analyzing pod logs for error information

name: Kyverno High Admission Webhook Failures.txt - Impact:
description: This section explains that when a Kubernetes pod configuration fails to meet certain best practices or policies enforced by Kyverno, the pod events will provide information on how to fix the configuration. The section suggests two options: either fix the pod configuration based on the recommendations in the pod events, or take an alternative approach that is not specified.
use_cases: Enforcing best practices for Kubernetes pod configurations
Troubleshooting and resolving Kyverno admission webhook failures
Ensuring compliance with organizational policies or industry standards

name: Kyverno High Admission Webhook Failures.txt - Disclaimer:
description: This section discusses the impact of not adhering to infrastructure and security best practices when configuring Kubernetes pods. It warns that pods will fail to start and remain in a pending state if their configuration violates these policies. Additionally, it mentions that any manual changes made to the configuration will be reverted by the FluxCD tool, which manages the configuration through reconciliation.
use_cases: Ensuring compliance with infrastructure and security best practices
Preventing pods from starting with non-compliant configurations
Automating configuration management and reconciliation using FluxCD
